com.hms_networks.americas.sc.string

Class QuoteSafeStringTokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.StringTokenizer
      • com.hms_networks.americas.sc.string.QuoteSafeStringTokenizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Enumeration<java.lang.Object>

    public class QuoteSafeStringTokenizer
extends java.util.StringTokenizer
    Class that extends StringTokenizer to allow for ignoring delimiters in double quoted strings.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    HMS Networks, MU Americas Solution Center

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currTokenIndex
      Index of the last returned token in the string
      private java.lang.String delimiter
      String to hold a local copy of the configured delimiter
      private boolean returnDelimiters
      boolean to track if tokenizer should return the delimiter as a separate token

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QuoteSafeStringTokenizer(java.lang.String str)
      Creates a new QuoteSafeStringTokenizer for the string str, that should split on the default delimiter set (space, tab, newline, return and formfeed), and which doesn't return the delimiters.
      QuoteSafeStringTokenizer(java.lang.String str, java.lang.String delim)
      Create a new QuoteSafeStringTokenizer, that splits the given string on the given delimiter characters.
      QuoteSafeStringTokenizer(java.lang.String str, java.lang.String delim, boolean returnDelims)
      Create a new QuoteSafeStringTokenizer, that splits the given string on the given delimiter characters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuoteSafeStringTokenizer

        public QuoteSafeStringTokenizer(java.lang.String str)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a new QuoteSafeStringTokenizer for the string str, that should split on the default delimiter set (space, tab, newline, return and formfeed), and which doesn't return the delimiters.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to split
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if str is null

      • QuoteSafeStringTokenizer

        public QuoteSafeStringTokenizer(java.lang.String str,
                                java.lang.String delim)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Create a new QuoteSafeStringTokenizer, that splits the given string on the given delimiter characters. It doesn't return the delimiter characters.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to split
        delim - a string containing all delimiter characters
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either argument is null

      • QuoteSafeStringTokenizer

        public QuoteSafeStringTokenizer(java.lang.String str,
                                java.lang.String delim,
                                boolean returnDelims)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Create a new QuoteSafeStringTokenizer, that splits the given string on the given delimiter characters. If you set returnDelims to true, the delimiter characters are returned as tokens of their own. The delimiter tokens always consist of a single character. If you set returnDelims to false, an empty string will be returned in the case of a delimiter occurring without a token before it and the previous delimiter.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to split
        delim - a string containing all delimiter characters
        returnDelims - tells if you want to get the delimiters
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if str or delim is null

        public java.lang.String nextTokenIgnoreQuotes()
                                       throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
